title: Reveal a ggplot Incrementally
text: Create graph ggplot2 usual.  use one reveal_* functions (e.g. reveal_groups(), reveal_layers(), reveal_aes()) obtain list plots show elements incrementally.    probably want save plots include later presentation. Use reveal_save():
code: library(palmerpenguins) library(ggplot2) library(ggreveal)  p <-  ggplot(penguins[!is.na(penguins$sex),],              aes(body_mass_g, bill_length_mm,                  group=sex, color=sex)) +       geom_point() +       geom_smooth(method="lm", formula = 'y ~ x', linewidth=1) +       facet_wrap(~species) +       theme_minimal() p plot_list <- reveal_groups(p) plot_list #> [[1]] #>  #> [[2]] #>  #> [[3]] reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot.png", width = 8, height = 4) ── Saving incremental plots ──  ✔ myplot_0.png ✔ myplot_1.png ✔ myplot_2_last.png

title: Reveal plot by aes — reveal_aes
text: Turns ggplot list plots, showing data incrementally arbitrary aesthetic.

title: Reveal plot by aes — reveal_aes
text: p ggplot2 object aes aesthetic reveal E.g.: group, colour, shape, linetype order (optional) numeric vector specifying order reveal levels specified aesthetic. example, aes='shape' plot uses three shapes, order = c(3, 2, 1) invert order revealed. shape included vector omitted incremental plots. E.g.: order = c(3, 1), second shape shown. default, first plot blank, showing layout elements (title, legends, axes, etc) data. omit blank plot, include -1: e.g. order = c(-1, 3, 1), order = -1. max maximum number unique levels aesthetic used

title: Reveal plot by aes — reveal_aes
text: list ggplot2 objects, can passed reveal_save()

title: Reveal plot by aes — reveal_aes
code: # Create full plot library(ggplot2)   p <-  ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt,               color = factor(vs),               group = factor(vs))) +        geom_point(aes(shape=factor(am)), size=2) +        geom_smooth(method="lm",                    formula = 'y ~ x',                    linewidth=1)   p    plot_list <- reveal_aes(p, "shape")  plot_list[[1]]   plot_list[[2]]   plot_list[[3]]   plot_list[[4]]    # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot.png", width = 8, height = 4, path = tempdir()) #>  #> ── Saving incremental plots ── #>  #> ✔ /tmp/RtmpkSGvsc/myplot_0.png #> ✔ /tmp/RtmpkSGvsc/myplot_1.png #> ✔ /tmp/RtmpkSGvsc/myplot_2.png #> ✔ /tmp/RtmpkSGvsc/myplot_3_last.png  # Clean temp files file.remove(list.files(path = tempdir(), pattern = "myplot", full.names = TRUE))  #> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE

title: Reveal plot by panel — reveal_panels
text: Turns ggplot list plots, showing data incrementally panels.

title: Reveal plot by panel — reveal_panels
text: p ggplot2 object order (optional) numeric vector specifying order reveal panels example, three panels plot, order = c(3, 2, 1) invert order revealed. panel included vector omitted incremental plots. E.g.: order = c(3, 1), second panel shown. default, first plot blank, showing layout elements (title, legends, axes, etc) data. omit blank plot, include -1: e.g. order = c(-1, 3, 1), order = -1. (optional) one "data" "everything".' "data" (default), basic graph layout, including axes facet labels, shown start, data points shown incrementally. "everything", entire panels shown incrementally.

title: Reveal plot by panel — reveal_panels
text: list ggplot2 objects, can passed reveal_save()

title: Reveal plot by panel — reveal_panels
code: # Create full plot library(ggplot2) data("mtcars")  p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt,              color = factor(vs),              group = factor(vs))) +      geom_point() +      geom_smooth(method="lm",               formula = 'y ~ x',               linewidth=1) +      facet_wrap(~am) p   # Only data plot_list <- reveal_panels(p, what = "data") plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   # Everything plot_list <- reveal_panels(p, what = "everything") plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot.png", width = 8, height = 4, path = tempdir()) #>  #> ── Saving incremental plots ── #>  #> ✔ /tmp/RtmpkSGvsc/myplot_0.png #> ✔ /tmp/RtmpkSGvsc/myplot_1.png #> ✔ /tmp/RtmpkSGvsc/myplot_2_last.png  # Clean temp files file.remove(list.files(path = tempdir(), pattern = "myplot", full.names = TRUE))  #> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE

title: Reveal a patchwork — reveal_patchwork
code: # Compose plots with patchwork if (require("patchwork")) {     library(ggplot2)    library(patchwork)    data("mtcars")        p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) +            geom_point(aes(mpg, disp)) +            ggtitle('Plot 1')        p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) +            geom_boxplot(aes(gear, disp, group = gear)) +            ggtitle('Plot 2')        p3 <- ggplot(mtcars) +           geom_point(aes(hp, wt)) +           ggtitle('Plot 3')        p <- (p1 | p2) / p3    p <- p + plot_annotation(title = 'The surprising truth about mtcars',                             tag_levels = 'A'                             )        plot_list <- reveal_patchwork(p)    plot_list[[1]]    plot_list[[2]]    plot_list[[3]]  } #> Loading required package: patchwork
